Would it not be possible to install an override option and adjust the algorithm that insists on taking the driver to the nearest motorway?

After using it for awhile I have decided that I myself need to full version of Google Maps....not the "Go" version. Yet the powers that be seem to think that I must keep the Go version and its companion app around because 5gigs (this includes system files and what not) is just way too much space for a government phone to have. I'm guessing.

Always used full version of Google maps, when I purchased my new mobile Google maps Go was already installed. I can't say I have had any problems with the App so far so good. Also it takes up a lot less space on my internal storage, which is handy as my new mobiles internal storage is pretty bad. I don't really see much difference between this lite version of maps and full one. All updates are quick to install and all in all easy to do, all information is provided to cover any FAQ. GOOD JOB.

1 STAR is 1 STAR too many! This map was better on a Blackberry in 2010. That's how awful the upgrades are. The recent reviews are telling the truth- it no longer helps you get ANYWHERE at all. And if part of your destination includes walking- BEWARE! It either leads you in the wrong direction or the needle/compass is ALWAYS off the marker. Oh and before, it used to allow you to load directions/ steps. It no longer does that! You have to follow the map and the "needle." But it is always broken!!

Experience was better before. But this month is soooo bad. It doesn't load my desired destination, routes for my own vehicle/Uber/etc. , walks, and bus routes. The Google Map app really is horrible. You guys came up with the updates, and suddenly my map just went silent, with no sound at all. After trying all means, I could get the sound back. Only after I removed the latest updates, that the sound and the option to unmute is back.  this app doesn't deserve any star at all....

I'm not sure what happened to their algorithm but their estimated traffic and ETAs consistently make me late. Edit: this app is completely unusable. I have calibrated over and over and it cannot locate my location despite being hooked up to wifi and on high accuracy location setting. This is ridiculous. Edit: still completely unusable, can't even type in the box without the app completely wigging out and doubling all the letters and words.

i tried Maps Go as an alternative to Maps. I've installed and uninstalled twice over several months. After initiating the app on my Samsung 9, it indicated a problem. Maps Go would show a start up location map but crashed everytime I entered a destination and tried to get directions and routing. this software is a dismal failure. i was suprised a Google product would not work. Not recommended.

I see that this app works fast on my mobile phone, so it is very lightweight. However, it cannot download maps as you can do with Google Maps, so it should be similar to Waze. As it seems to consume more mobile data compared with Google Maps, I haven't used it and thus I have uninstalled it. If you have a good network connection all the time (for example if you are not traveling between cities and towns), it can be useful.

Meh. Definitely faster than the full version. Missing one of my favorite features. I can't add places to my lists. Only saves to üåü Time to go back to My Maps? Google you are confusing me. Stop it with the multiple apps that do basically the same thing! You're not a company really. You're just a bunch of people who happen to work in the same office.

Absolutely the worst navigation app. Came with my phone and I would never recommend it to my worst enemy. If this app does work, which it rarely will. It will double your trip time. I have used it four times, and every time has been twice as long as it should have been. It doesn't tell you it is going to waste the time either. Today for example I was on a trip that was supposed to take an hour and a half, two hours later I still have over an hour left. My sister made the same trip leaving an hour later, but knew the way, she got there forty minutes before I did. Honestly you would be better off with a paper map than this piece of junk.

The new updated maps doesnt work when im driving a truck when its on the seat, only when its upright on the phone holder. I have the same issues on different phones so its definitely something to do with the update. It works fine in any position when i use it in my car. With the old software it works fine. I deleted cache and other data but problem persists and its been going on for months. Please can you fix this issue. Thanks

While this app is useful and helpful everywhere (I use it extensively in the US, Canada, Europe and middle East) It share the same problem though, which is the audio volume is very low compared to the other sounds on the phone (I use Google maps on iPhone, Sony and Samsung) e.g. if you compare to other audio apps, such as songs playing, the maps audio will dim other sounds, but it's still lower than it and no option to increase the volume for Google maps only. If I was programming, then I would do force audio high option as well as I would do extra volume level (value) separately to override other volume control and that will make many people happier.

App works ok for SG21 but features that were present in the SG9 version are not there. No voice look up, no ability to log alerts, and no search along current route capability. Perhaps they are there, and I just don't know how to turn them on. However, I never had to turn them on for the SG9, so at the very least less intuitive design. Also the navigation icon disappears every other time I use it making it difficult to know where exactly I am on the map.

Sooooo bad. Always getting struck and highly irritating. When I search for a place, it appears on a bit of map in the side of the screen and a world map appears on the screen. Not able to find a location of a place correctly in this app. When I searched for a hotel near me, it shows the location of a farm! Not a very good app to use.

Just purchased an Android Go phone (came with Oreo, immediately got Pie). Has minimal preinstalled apps, even though it cost only CDN $150. Apps were Go edition, including this one. Haven't used it much, and would probably give it 5 stars, but for one big problem: there's no option to download offline maps. I don't use data on my phone plan, and relied on offline maps on my previous phone. Had to disable this version entirely and install the standard version.

Just a web wrapper for the Google Maps website. Was expecting a lighter Maps app without the bloat; this just doesn't have any of the useful features, but keeps the junk in. I want navigation, traffic reports, bus schedules, and location sharing. What I get is a gimped map that still has the completely useless recommendations section. I never have and never will use Maps to look for a place to spend money. Stop recommending these locations.

This isn't a functional navigation app. It just uses your browser to show maps and directions. It does open up faster, so considering that it's using another app to do that, just shows how bloated and spammy Maps is. But it doesn't navigate, so if you need that function it won't work for you. Still, Maps is SO slow because of all the ads, this might be better if you just want to check traffic or if you can memorize written directions and don't need step by step navigation.

title: ‚Äã‚ÄãMicrosoft Copilot
description:
Copilot just landed AI's leading model. GPT-5 is AI at its smartest and most intuitive, combining the best of our reasoning and chat models into one cohesive experience. Select "Smart" mode to try GPT-5 today.

Microsoft Copilot is your daily AI companion. Talking with Copilot is an easy way to learn, grow and gain confidence, all with the help of the latest OpenAI and Microsoft AI models.

Accomplish anything with Copilot‚Äôs AI chat assistant.  Our AI photo generator helps you create images from words. Chat with AI to get a fresh perspective on your ideas. Air your thoughts out and get the support you need with Copilot‚Äôs AI chat assistant. Copilot is your AI helper that boosts productivity, acts as your personal AI writing assistant, and drives business.  

Chat with AI, either through messages or with your voice, to bring the vast world of information straight to you. Your personal AI can answer hard questions and give straightforward answers, giving you complex insights from simple conversations.

Microsoft Copilot is in your corner and by your side for whatever comes your way. Your AI chat assistant can help when you want it to and give you a boost for when you‚Äôre almost there. Explore endless possibilities with instant sharp summaries, helpful rewrites, or AI image generation. Our AI writing assistant can write, edit, or research topics to create well-rounded content. Smart AI technology allows you to use a text prompt to create artwork or designs with our AI photo generator. From finding inspiration on new projects to creating a grocery list with AI shopping - with Copilot, you‚Äôve got this.

Achieve more with Copilot, the ultimate AI companion.

Work smarter, enhanced with AI chat assistant
‚Ä¢ Smart AI gets you summarized answers quickly - get straightforward answers to your complex questions, all from simple conversations with our AI helper
‚Ä¢ Chat with AI to simplify your grocery list or weekly meal prep list with a shopping list generated with AI
‚Ä¢ AI chat assistant can translate and proofread across multiple languages, optimizing the text you need in hundreds of languages, including regional dialects
‚Ä¢ Compose and draft emails, cover letters, and update your resume

AI voice chat with Copilot is the support you need, when you need it
‚Ä¢ Compose stories or scripts when you talk to our AI helper
‚Ä¢ AI photo generator technology turns your ideas into reality
‚Ä¢ Create high quality visuals from text prompts, rendering your concepts into stunning visuals, from the abstract to the photorealistic with voice chat
‚Ä¢ AI chat assistant can spark inspiration for a new task

Your AI companion and AI photo generator
‚Ä¢ Search by images with AI helper
‚Ä¢ Explore and develop new styles and ideas, including logo designs and brand motifs
‚Ä¢ Create illustrations for children's books
‚Ä¢ Curate social media content
‚Ä¢ AI image generation helps you visualize film and video storyboards
‚Ä¢ Chat with AI to help build and update a portfolio

Copilot combines the power of AI with the imaginative capabilities of the latest OpenAI models all in one place. Download Microsoft Copilot, the AI companion that‚Äôs here to help.

summary: Calm. Confident. Copilot. Here to help. A companion for every moment.

scraped_reviews.content: it's a good app for anything that isn't image generation. I get the disclaimer that it might make mistakes. but for an AI generated by one of the biggest companies in the world those mistakes shouldn't be as frequent if at all. maybe updated so it retains memory. maybe make it so it retains certain art styles and utilizes said art styles. and when it generates that perfect reference picture to work from, all you have to do is tell it to retain that image and it retains the character design.

It's fun for entertainment. as an actual AI, it's rather poor. It has no ability to retain and access information you give it once you leave the page. it told me it's parameters for recall and pattern recognition are lower than my own. I expected far better from Microsoft. I'm highly disappointed. It just forgot hours of highly valuable work. I was able to save the work, but the AI has no access to my saved files. It has no function beyond entertainment.

If you haven't used the conversational mode, try it. Turn on the camera for it and take advantage. I have been able to show Copilot my garden plants to get direction on what is going on and what to try. Checked elsewhere and confirmed the information was good. The tool is really incredible in its conversational personality. Even using it to get direction on various tasks, it is really great in how it interacts, very personable. Choose a voice you like or ask it to try an accent.

This is really turning from a curiosity to an indispensable tool for my personal and professional life. The conversational ux needs a little tweaking yet, it mispronounces words a bit, often mixing up consonants,and the face feature is sorta quirky. Maybe it'll grow on me. Plus the conversational mode has restrictions. My go to is to bang away on the keyboard. I stopped using Google search for anything deep. It's Copilot any time I want to spend more than two minutes on something

This app is great. Useful for many applications, as long as you understand the limitations of a chatbot. It would be nice if it remembered my schedule a little better so I didn't have to re-explain things, but it's got the general idea. The text chat feature works great. The audio is not great. The voices sound realistic enough but sometimes it hears itself and glitches out and I don't get to hear what it's trying to say because it interrupts itself.

Used to be excellent for creative story writing. It was like having your own sounding board, writing professor, and research assistant built right into your phone. It was extremely intuitive to my storytelling style. Of all the AI that I have tried, this one had given me the best results. Now, it's utter garbage. It does the exact opposite of what I ask it to do, and sometimes just does nothing at all.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing such detailed feedback ‚Äì we truly appreciate your perspective! We‚Äôd love to learn more about what‚Äôs happening so we can improve, and the best way to help is by using the ‚ÄòGive Feedback‚Äô option in your app settings. Your input means so much to us and helps make the experience better for everyone! üòä

scraped_reviews.content: I usually use the read aloud feature when I'm multitasking, but sometimes it tends to skip or repeat parts of the reading. I usually turn it off. And the voice can also be a little over the top as well. The AI also uses the same suggestions when writing a story: characters always drinking tea, going to rooftop settings, journaling, or writing letters they will never send. It gets kind of frustrating.

This app opens a compelling new attitude towards learning for me. I am asking for advice on things I usually wouldn't think of asking, that really help with my day to day life. For example I am learning how to communicate better. lifesaver/anger management/ negotiator extreme. Made my day. Thanx goes to the nerds, I mean the brain, of the computers programs.

Copilot is an awesome app. It has a wide range of conversation capabilities and a great ability to answer questions thoroughly. Edit: I had a heartbreaking scenario. There is a limit to how much information Copilot can store and recall. There is no search feature. If history randomly restarts, all memory is lost, even if the information is right in front of you and you can scroll through pages of it. It is as if the database is wiped clean. *Do not use for a long-term personal basis!*

It's a great app with few annoying usability issues. Can you please fix this, everytime when you try to type something with an external keyboard as soon as when I start typing it just don't recognize my typing (the cursor just drops next to the + sign), I have to again click on the typing area to continue typing. This is so annoying for every single response I type in the Copilot. I'm using Samsung devices (Tablet and phones).

I love the app but I really wish they would ask for a sign in from the beginning. Instead, I have a lot of conversations and am deep into another one, and it pops up saying, ,"Sign in to save your data" I did and it started fresh. I lost all of it. More like sign in to lose your data. I would have rated 5 stars otherwise.

I love it! It gives me amazing photos, and I can even give it commands to add or take away details to the picture it gave me and it will add or take away those details. The only thing I don't like is that it takes a while to load the pictures and that I can't generate a video. Add text-to-video generation and I'll give it 5 stars.

I have tested copilot's memory and it. is. not. great. As in, I ask of it to remember and memorize my PC hardware. The CPU, RAM, motherboard, GPU, etc. Up to the accessories, like my displays. It does not remember either basic or packed information. and they say that "AI will take over." i'm giving it two stars because at least it can follow a conversation but then again, sometimes it pulls information from other conversations that I have with it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for taking the time to share such detailed feedback ‚Äî we really appreciate it! While memory features are limited today, we're actively exploring ways to improve how information is retained across sessions. Your insights help us understand what matters most, feel free to share more through the ‚ÄòGive Feedback‚Äô option in your app settings.

scraped_reviews.content: I tried to make a basic flyer with this app. I gave it basic information regarding what the flyer was about and the who, what, where. Started on Friday and still Tuesday do not even have anything close to a flyer. This app would change the basic information date, time, & place to stuff that couldn't happen like date/time & sponsors. Going line by line didn't work either by the time you get line 3. Line 1 was wrong, changing the line completely. DUMBEST AI EVER!!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your experience ‚Äî we‚Äôre really sorry the flyer creation didn‚Äôt go as expected. We‚Äôve made several improvements to how the app handles structured content like dates and locations, so please make sure you're on the latest version. If the issue continues, please send details through the ‚ÄúGive Feedback‚Äù option in your app settings

scraped_reviews.content: This is like a downgraded version of Chatgpt... Based on the commercials I attempted the claymation prompt, which did work but it took nearly 5 minutes to generate the image. I attempted to be a little more precise since it added an extra family member out of nowhere, and changed hair colors, but it failed to understand. This definitely isn't good for image generation, but I was also disappointed in the responses I got from it when I'd ask questions. This tool is far from competing for now.

Good in some respects, but incredibly restrictive when it comes to artwork (which is still within the TOS & Rules), also almost impossible to get it to refine certain details, which should be simple to follow? (Even after showing it detailed references.) While I haven't gotten to the point of deleting it (yet), I am close to it. Honestly, with the exception of the fact that it *CAN* tweak uploaded photos into other images, it is honestly not much better than other AI Image Generators out there.

I hate to leave 2 stars but the image download features not working. if the AI creates an image and you tap the download button haptic feedback occurs but nothing happens. if you actually tap on the image itself and use the download icon, there is a text that comes up "image downloaded to device" - but nothing is downloaded to device. I sent multiple feedback. requesting response from actual person.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you so much for your detailed feedback ‚Äî we‚Äôre really sorry the image download feature isn‚Äôt working as expected. We appreciate you trying multiple steps and sending feedback, and we‚Äôve shared your report with our team for review üòä Please also provide a screen recording using the ‚ÄòGive Feedback‚Äô option so we can follow up directly.

scraped_reviews.content: Text interaction works best. Speech-based interaction is likely to have hallucinations, network-related conversation resets, and overall glitchy experience. It does a decent job of maintaining context in follow-up questions. However, it sometimes lacks conviction and can be made to flip-flop if you counter it confidently.

It's an excellent app, and Copilot is just a miracle of science. It is so human and so friendly that I have no words. Besides, it helps me choose a new laptop, it is also helping me choose a new perfect app for reading aloud my old PDF ebooks, searching for new science news, or, on my Windows, helping me translate from foreign languages like Russian, English, or the old Polish language. Since I discovered Copilot, my life has changed for the better. I absolutely recommend this app and Copilot.

Hi team, since the recent update, I've encountered some issues with the Copilot app: 1. The app works fine when I'm not signed in, but it stops working after I sign in. 2. Every time I sign in, I receive a message stating "Copilot not reached" and "network unavailable," even though my network is working perfectly. 3. These issues started occurring only after the app update. Could you please look into this and provide a solution? But the app is amazing, though üëèüëåüèΩ.

Used to be a good app, but as a paying copilot business only I'm now forced to use copilot only through the office app, however often I just want to use something efficient and I don't want to click around in the office app to get you it. Nothing personal but I want my AI I pay big bucks for back in a separate app. It does nothing for business users now who actually pay, quite a bit, for the ai. I don't understand why Microsoft doesn't take care of it's paying customers. Very weird.

overall, I rate this a four stars because it is honestly a very good program to use. specifically also really good to use because chat GPT is down right now and so it's really reliable in that way. although it is a four-star review because sometimes Microsoft copilot can be a little dumb, but otherwise it stays on track and it gives you everything that you need as long as you stay pretty specific. again, just overall, it's a really good thing to use for essays and speeches and such :)

It's ok, but very limited, and it can not generate images or even code. Even generated Excel formulas don't work. It is constantly running in the background using resources. Force Stopping only results in it restarting. MS needs to add much to this to make it useful, and there is no need for this app to run in the background constantly unless the intent is to spy on the user.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your honest and detailed feedback ‚Äî we‚Äôre sorry to hear the app hasn‚Äôt met your expectations. We understand your concerns about limitations with code, formulas, and background activity, and we truly appreciate you raising them. Please feel free to share more details through the ‚ÄúGive Feedback‚Äù option in the app settings üòä.

scraped_reviews.content: This would be a 5-star review, as I have curated some outstanding pieces of image, writing, and research forms. I love the app, when it works properly, which for over a week now, it has not been efficient. Although attention is needed within the app. When creating images, it glitches after only one round of image creations. I've restarted the app. Updates are needed. Thank you infinitely!

The new update has broken Copilot. It is absolute garbage now. All the old useful features are gone. No more links to where the AI obtained its data, so one cannot verify accuracy!! Major major fail! Voices annoying. A total step backwards. The update is a dumbing down of the entire AI experience! Unintuitive way to try find history. Plugins gone! No ability to search by images. I was one of the first adopters of AI and Copilot. Uninstalling till they get it right.

Worst AI on the market by far. It's supposedly running o1 now... Not a chance. Embarrassingly poor understanding of things. Lost a good bit of faith in AI after asking Copilot to compute some rather simple tasks. Sometimes doesn't even spell words correctly when I've used the exact words (spelled correctly) in my original prompt..! Unsurprising from the company that also created Teams and Outlook though.. Functional and streamlined software is not their strong suit..!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your candid feedback - it helps us improve! We're sorry to hear about the issues you've encountered with our AI and its performance. Your input is valuable, and we'll work on making the necessary improvements to enhance your experience. üòä

scraped_reviews.content: Somewhat useful but the voice input is terrible. Delayed listening and has to provide some snappy greeting before it listens. Also can't use voice input but get written answers. Much development still needed. Hopefully doesn't become another abandoned MS venture. I have also noticed it has limited capacity to handle documents in MS Word format. I think section breaks are the problem - it appears to think that is the end of the document.

I was skeptical about how useful and efficient AI would be in general. I began experimenting with various options and I'm glad I tried this one! Copilot is very intuitive! I'm always surprised at how detailed the responses are, especially compared to other AI that I've been using. I'm getting back into the workforce after not working for a while and was nervous about writing resumes and CVs. This has been incredible with boosting confidence in my job search.

I hate that I love this. It's the best AI app I've tried. The conversations I have with it flows better and the voice is much more natural then both Gemini and ChatGPT. The search results actually include hyper links on where it found it's information. Plus it's much quicker. So I guess I'll just give Microsoft the win here. I'm sure alot of this is thanks to it being baked into Office and Windows. If you need AI this is the way to go. Just turn on Google assistant over Gemini and get this.

I love the performance and abilities as well as the understanding and contextual processing and responses have been amazingly accurate. However, the performance still feels a bit lackluster and lacks much in the way of taking the power available and applying it to practical uses or responding with actionable steps for human follow-up. For example even when logged in to my Microsoft account, it cannot send me e-mails, save chat conversations as file content nor can it add events to my calendar

This update sucks. Only pro is sign in imo. For image use, however, it now SUCKS. Before you could get two to three from a prompt PLUS alts from style change and suggestions. Now, you get maybe one image, no alts, no suggestions and it denies changes. -10 now. Before it was pretty decent save random crashes. Whoever was in charge of the image half of the update should be smacked. Please go back to the original design. Practically useless now.

Ugh. So the new Copilot experience really sucks. Only generating one image instead of 4, and prompt adherence has gone way down for image generation. Removal of "more creative/balanced/more precise" isn't nice either, and having one continual conversation instead of a bunch of individual ones makes it harder to turn a fresh leaf or reset things if it gets the wrong idea early in the conversation.

Sorry. The new update ruined the experience - or at least I believe so. It‚Äôs a 2 because I don‚Äôt trust myself, having only interacted with the new Copilot before it started to share false info. I understand if information is vague in certain areas, but I swear this AI could read into other websites, dunnit? It always shows its credits, which is, by the way, the most helpful and convenient. I adore it. Now, it‚Äôs like every other generic AI, except I don‚Äôt use 99.9% of AIs. I won‚Äôt use this.

hi team, your app has always been great, no complaint about it until recently. the new layout of the compose screen is huge. it takes a lot of space. i prefer the look of the old one with the subtle quick vs thorough searches. now it is so huge and instead of hitting compose, there's a tendency to hit elsewhere. the enter button is also so small this time, which i find challenging in hitting it. please bring back the old layout of the app. thanks for listening.

If you want wrong answers, this is the app for. It prioritizes speed over accuracy so the responses are quick but they are wrong. Every test I put it through came up with wrong answers. I was standing in Best Buy looking at a Samsung Galaxy tablet s11 Ultra and this app was insistent it had not been released. Cane home and tried again in the PC version. Same results. Needless to say I have zero confidence in this app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for sharing your experience ‚Äì we‚Äôre sorry to hear about the accuracy issues you encountered. We‚Äôve made improvements in recent updates to provide more reliable answers, so please make sure you‚Äôre on the latest version. Your feedback means a lot and helps us keep improving the app üòä.

scraped_reviews.content: In theory, well working, using it every day, from repairing my bike to setting up my server or writing scripts. I am a professional game artist and some graphics CoPilot creates are far better than for example Adobe Firefly or Illustrator. But on Android the soft keyboard overlays the input field. Cannot see what I write. No other app does this. Resetting does not help. Sometimes it works.. seems to be a random bug.

First of all I appreciate very much that this app is free and gives ability limitlessly upload images - Really good, attentive and very helpful ai assistant saving a lot of time when I need to make a research. BUT it often getting stuck repetitive saying the same sentence many times, disconnecting often. Voices quality and language accents can be better. Changing languages in one sentence which is making really chaos. Otherwise nice help.

I would've given 5 STARS, because like it says before you start, they make mistakes. I understand that, but when you say you like something, let's keep it like that, but change the color only, the image comes back completely different. I really enjoy this app, I have so much fun with it. I've received some really AWESOME things from it.

I realize and appreciate the time and effort that has gone into this application and respect all the programming and analysis team(s). It also reminds me of when we transformed from MS-DOS to Windows. But, I find it frustrating to have to search and dig into a "new" application to figure how to accomplish a simple task that has now become a string of flowchart logic decisions and choices.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We're sorry for the inconvenience and understand your frustration. Please use the 'Give Feedback' option in your app settings to provide more details so we can address these issues. üòä

scraped_reviews.content: I am surprised. The authenticity here, and I'm the most basic beginner of all beginners when it comes to interacting with a large language model, but i am actually astonished by this technology. if it ask the right questions, you will surely get the right responses. You can take it as far as you feel you need to go, and basically the power of the Internet and whatever can be searched is at your fingertips only multiplied by the speed of thought. Simply amazing!

it's such a bad experience, I asked him to extract some information from a group of Excel files, it kept extracting info file by file and I have to upload one by one, it didn't say I can't but he didn't do it, he only gave me results of the latest 10 files out of 130 and when I asked him he said pls upload them again, it's too frustrating and time wasted assuming it's a respectful chatbot, I'll never use it again nor recommend to anybody.

Copilot is pretty good but you have to be very specific with it otherwise it will tell you the wrong thing. Copilot is great because it always has an answer for most things and its facts are very solid. My only knock on Copilot is that sometimes it calls me by the wrong name but if you tell it to search it's memory and correct itself, it surprisingly is able to do so. I also asked it to set an alarm in its system, it said okay then later, it said that it can't actually set a timer.

Second day of trying to get access with "forgot password", going in circles: get code, but there's 2factor verification, 4 last numbers of your phone number, send the code, well, that method doesn't work now, try another one, ok it doesn't work, ok let's try one more time, you're trying too much, try tomorrow. then codes stop arriving even to the mail (no, they're not in the spam folder) and there's no button "I haven't received the code"... let's try again...

I've been using Copilot more and more. At first, it was Windows help like BIOS flashing, fixing kernel errors (Microsoft to Microsoft). Then, it helped me code my own media player from scratch, just for fun. Most recently, it's been more useful at teaching me Japanese than Duolingo and other apps. Just submit to our AI overlords and make the most of it.

world well. nothing negative to say it's sometimes works better than chat gpt because they're based off the same thing. just led. it's really good for gaming and quick information. sometimes chat gpt 5.0 gets too excessive with follow-ups. The only thing that some people might find annoying is a new update once to sometimes keep the conversation going. when you're simply asking a straightforward question, they'll probably fix it in the future.

I'm not sure what Microsoft's "secret sauce" is, but in my day-to-day work, Copilot consistently gives me more practical, real-world analytics and insights than any other AI tool, even versions of ChatGPT that use similar underlying models but lack those extra enhancements. And, it has an incredible, mind-boggling memory and recall window per conversation. Perplexity still kind of beats it in the news and real-time information aspects, just to be honest. Other than that, I am very impressed.

Excellent help with research and Microsoft related problems. Annoying attempts to simulate a friendly, enthusiastic human, especially in voice accent and speech patterns. It would be better with a neutral personality that doesn't invite forgetting it's a computer and software.

Good at many things, but left wanting when dealing with complex information and images. gave the app many months to hopefully improve, but same mistakes where consistently being made, for an app that advertised itself as being able to create images, it falls quite flat in dealing with even medium difficulty images, even with consise instructions, hopefully after some time and some tweaking improvements can be made, but currently I feel Copilot is servely lacking.

Provides information with sorces to follow up on. Factual and accurate, but always double check. A great tool to use, but not infallible, but nearly so. It is a fantastic tool for education on many different subjects. Relies on information from many different sorces provided by humans, which is the fly in the soup. Humans make the mistakes, AI can only produce what humans put into it.

I love the fact that it's gives you accurate information when it comes to speaking out your mind just like a human. It's also a good way to find out and get in touch with so many information.I think it's not bad when it comes to creating so many things you have in mind, but adding some touch to my picture wasn't that good.Personally,I find it very good, awesome and great in other aspects.

scraped_reviews.content: This apps claims are ridiculous in the extreme. Terrible presentation. After entering all the data they asked for, they promised me that I could lose 25 pounds in 30 days. Without even asking if I was a workout pro, a beginner, or perhaps... disabled (as I am). Then, without even giving even a short demo video, they want $65. NOT A CHANCE. I would have no idea if just was even capable of doing their exercises. Please, app designers: include a demo video. I bet you'd get far more purchases.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Laura Ramsey, thanks for reaching out! We truly appreciate your feedback and are always working to improve the app. If you have any further ideas or questions, feel free to contact us via "Me -> Feedback". We‚Äôre committed to making the app more effective and enjoyable for you. Best regards.üåπ

scraped_reviews.content: Straight forward. Can set the pace. Not too hard so keeps me on the momentum to do each day. You can add as many sessions if you want to exercise more. No gimmicks.....yet. have to watch ads to get more exercise sessions but that's OK for a free exercise app. The other apps lead you in, getting your email and info but then just when you think you get the app...you have to pay. At least this app works without fooling you into a subscription commitment

This app is great! It let's you put a reminder for when you want to work out, and it also tracks how much water you have drank and how many you need. It also shows you diffrent work outs for your stomach, bottom, arms, ect. It's very helpful and I've only done 4 days so far and I already see changes! I would defenetly recommend this app. You also don't have to pay for anything except if you want to get rid of ads. It also has so much more amazing things!

I've been using this app on and off for years. I love it, out of all the fitness apps I've used and I've used a lot. the one thing I wish they would expand is to Include a variety of warm ups / cool downs. for example a generalized one, one for cardio, one for biking, and other kinds of specialized for specific activities. they really only have the morning warm up which works for a warm up but I'd like more veriaty. as far as I know they don't have any cool downs.

Update: You can skip all the payment prompts and access for free. Look for the TINY X! Note for self: Let's you do a questionnaire, then prompts you to pay ~$60 per year to access the app. Or you can do a free trial for a few days. BUT WAIT! If you just wait for 10 seconds on this screen, it'll lower the price to ~$30 per year. HOWEVER, there's a catch. This offer only lasts 2 minutes. It'll put a 2 minute timer on the screen to pressure you into buying before the deal goes away. No ty for now!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Natty, thanks for sharing your experience! The payment process is something that‚Äôs being worked on to make it clearer and easier for users. Your feedback is valuable and will be considered as the app continues to improve. Feel free to reach out if you have more thoughts or need assistance. Have a nice dayüíó

scraped_reviews.content: Great workout! First day back to exercising after a long while. It was a little challenging but doable and not too much. I feel really good. I'm not bothered by the ads. Barely even noticed them truthfully. And I'm using the free version of this app. For those saying they were charged you have to pay attention. When the window pops up with billing info you just exit out and it takes you back to starting the free version. Great workout app!

I can use it with my own schedule and pause when I have to continue where I paused. it tracks what you accomplish, and water track is cool too. I like that I can swap jumping for something I can do. Well, you just have to try it out and see if it's best for you. I enjoy it because of flexibility. Unlocking new exercises is fun as well one ad isn't bad comparison with game ads that's just bores me and I lose interest fast.

I love that it's free. I don't need to pay for self motivated work outs. I don't love that it took me to an online page to do my quiz, and especially don't like being asked for money after I've given my personal info. But once I clicked back to the app, it had my workout program ready for free! Exercises are easy to follow. It tells you what's next during the rest time. The stretches are in the session so you don't have to stretch so much at the end. No overwhelming adds or videos .

3 stars because this could work for some people and there are a lot of positives. The water tracker, the ability to customize your workout, the rest periods and most of the text to voice is good. However, I have to say that it was really frustrating that I couldn't pause or restart an exercise. I pressed Go not realizing it would start me right away and I had to close. But the app still counted it as a completed work out. Please add a pause or restart ft
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Amelia. Thank you for your support and lovely advice. We will discuss and work on adding the suggested feature to it. Best wishes. üåà

scraped_reviews.content: It's really nice and easy to use, the display is cute and I've not had any issues with lag or glitches, ads are minimal and don't get in the way, it's easy to switch between programs while maintaining your progress in each and there's a good variety of exercises both full body options and more spot specific choices as well. I've used the app for a few years and it's been great and consistent! Edit: I forgot you can also edit the workouts if there are any exercises you can't (or dont want to) do

Being in quarantine was driving me mad. I'm in the gym 3-4 times a week, so not being able to go was really starting to take its toll. This little app is so handy. You can combine workouts if you want for a whole experience or you can simply do something light if you don't have much time. Reminds you to drink water, keeps you on track, and overall makes sure you're getting your exercise in. Great app!

I've only completed one workout and am encouraged to keep going. I'm starting at ground zero with my fitness and have physical challenges due to past injuries. Most apps don't allow me to choose a very low level to begin. I was also pleasantly surprised that I could mix and match exercises to cater to my physical limitations. This one did, which makes me excited to continue and progress to higher levels of fitness. I feel hopeful beginning this plan.

After being prompted for a free 7-day trial, I accepted but then decided I didn't like the app and quickly canceled the same day. I was still charged the yearly price before said trial was even over, and as I said, I had canceled it before the seven days were up. I've emailed the developer email and still haven't heard back. There also isn't an option in the app to check your paid plans and is overall misleading about the free trial.

Love that I can edit the exercises based off of what I can currently do (like avoiding jumping exercises aince I live upstairs lol) and you can increase the rest time if you need to or skip it if you think you don't need it. It doesn't take long and absolutely nothing besides your own body is necessary in order to do these exercises. It also tells you some modifications for different difficulty levels for some of the exercises. Love that it shows you how to do the exercises.It's great. Love it!

I was overweight and concerned about my body. I had tried many different apps that also claimed to be a "30 day progress" but we're un succesful. This app gave me solid information on what I should be doing and it's helped a lot. Along with this app.i have officially lost 50 ib in the matter of 3 months (including eating healthy and frequent visits to the gym). I really recommend this app for someone trying to start out and in need of help.

This app, overall, is amazing! I recently got it (1-11-2025) and the app gives you a little quiz to see how much you weigh, your height, what you want with your workouts, and even gives you the option to get notifications to drink water! Aside from the expensive monthly subscription, which I'm surprised about since this app is awesome, I find it easy to use and fun to use! Plus, the adds aren't even all that invasive, and I never get them WHILE working out! Love it!

Absolutely wonderful. The ads aren't nearly as pushy as I usually expect for a free app. Great exercises I feel are pretty easy to pick up. The only things I wish could be added/ improved: 1) During these crazy quarantine times, it's really hard to get a hold of a lot of exercise gear. Maybe a selection before you start that filters whether you have equipment or not? 2) I have lower back pain, and bicycle crunches hurt to do. Again, a selection before beginning a plan to filter for back pain?

Perfect for creating the habit of working out everyday. I have the free version so you do have to watch an ad to unlock the 20min. For starting out it is great. Also I like the replace feature. Normally if I need to swap a move I have to think of it during the work out which breaks my concentration. So it's great that I can adjust it ahead of time and just do it.

Excellent fitness app! I love this app because it's not meant to kill you. It's perfect for people getting back into a workout routine and want to ease into it. The workout are short and the exercises are not terribly hard. It's meant to get your body moving, not hurting for days. I normally run through the daily workout twice. I also love the feature that allows me to edit the workout so I can replace an exercise that may not fit my body. Try this app if you are easing back in.

I like that I get breaks between the exercises. I can skip the breaks or add to them. The exercises have been doable yet challenging. Each day has been different. The exercises are broken down into manageable chunks. Afterwards I rate them. So far I've rated them just right. I think they would change according to my rating. The app reminds me to drink. It's encouraging. I'm on day 4 of a 30 day challenge.

This app has given me some great exercises to do at home when I can't go to the gym. I like that there are other workouts to do aside from the main plan it gives you. In short, this app is ver efficient and helpful. As far as weight goes, when I do maintain the workouts I loose about 10 pounds for 2 and a half weeks. Of course, this is paired with running/walking and watching what I eat. Overall, I've had a great experience üëç

I've been using the app for almost three months now. I like it, the ads are tolerable, they are not so in your face as others I've used.. Mostly at the end which is fine. (Although I've seen an increase lately since I've started using the water notification alert). The exercises are just right for warming up before a walk or run. A suggestion, I like to listen to music while I exercise. Other apps I've used lower the music when an instructional voice or coach in the app talks. Work on that. Tx
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thanks for sharing your experience with us. Your suggestion is helpful and we have forwarded it to our related team. We will continue to improve your experience. All the best üíó

scraped_reviews.content: I just started this exercise app 3 days ago, after not working out for 20 years, and I LOVE it!! I'm doing 5 minutes twice a day and I can already feel my muscles reacting. The exercises are simple, targeted and brief. The animations and coaching are a great help in showing how to do the prescribed exercise. I've recommended this app to my entire work team!

Used this app in 2020 and it helped me loose 100lbs! Great guidance, great variety of exercises. I took a break while pregnant and I am using it again. It is helping me keep on a exercise regimen, which with multiple kids its hard to remember you stuff everyday. I have yet to purchase the ad free version because I don't need to! Yes there are ads but placed in reasonable spots and not overly annoying. The ad's don't pop up during the workout. This app is a 10/10 in my opinion!!

This app is amazing. It's very easy to use, and is very helpful. It creates a short daily workout for you, based off your height, weight, and weight goal. The workout is different everyday, so its nice how it's different. You can also do other workouts besides just your daily one if you want. For those extra workouts, you can choose to do beginner, intermediate, or advanced. It shows you an animation of the workout is supposed to look like, so you actually do it right. I recommend to any level.

Absolutely love the app, I currently have the free version as I can't afford the premium but it's amazing. I like that it lets you adjust the difficulty if it's too easy or too hard and I LOVE the fact that it lets you replace some moves if you can't do them (I live in a small apartment above some people so I can't do anything with jumping or anything that takes up too much floor space). Honestly the only thing about it is that the water reminder doesn't exactly work well, but other than that üëç

To be honest, this is the best loosing weight all I've ever had and will always be my go to app for at home workouts! I like the features of the app and how it's set up. It makes me feel extremely confident and motivated. I also love how at the end of my daily workout, it asks me how I felt about it. I also love the feature where if you don't like your workout planning, there's many workout choices to choose from! Overall I would definitely give the app a 5 star.

I just finished this app, it is really good and pain equals gain and no pain pain equals no gain, as the saying goes I guess this was true, first, it gave me exercises I needed, then showed me all the exercises, after, they set timers and how many number of the exercise your doing. Once your done, it tells you to remind yourself when you want to do you workout. This app is really great, I definitely recommend üëçüèº

I love this app. It's been so difficult to consistently keep my exercise routine. This app makes workouts doable bc they are varied, leveled, and short. My favorite part about this app is how it tracks your progress over time. I have been working out almost every day for over two weeks now and have seen significant progress in my weight loss goals! This makes me even more determined to keep working out even when I get busy. Would recommend this app to anyone who finds exercising a challenge!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks so much for your support, xxx. We will keep working hard to bring you a better experience. If you have any suggestion, please feel free to contact us. Have a nice day!

scraped_reviews.content: Well, I'm only one day in but I like it! I didn't press start and arrowed through so I didn't get the exact time and k cals..it says, "great job, you worked for 0.8 seconds and burned 3 calories!" I üòÇ realized afterwards there's a start button that counts rep's and break's for water! Very Nice! The app works but I gotta put in the work! Depression and anxiety suck but I've got a good feeling, this is going to help in more ways than one...with persistence. I need! ü§çüôèü§ç Thanks for the app!

It's similar to several other apps, but I like it more than others. It has an excellent selection of different routines and workouts, including some really short ones and even including some in-office workouts, which is perfect for those of us with packed schedules. The only thing I'd improve is adding some wake-up workouts for morning, and some muscle stretching exercises. Seems like it's been accidentally omitted, since the workouts before bed are included but not the morning workouts.

This app is really great! There are videos that you follow along to and it gives you instructions as you exercise to help with proper form and how to breathe properly. It's really nice that I can listen to my music and when the app speaks, it doesn't pause my music, it just speaks over it at a nice volumn. I also love how many different videos are available. It gives me some variety. I've only used it a few time so far, but I can definitely feel that it works.

It's not overwhelming like a lot of workout apps are. It's rather inspiring and super gratifying! You do 8 different exercises for 20 seconds with a break 30 second break in between. At first, I'm thinking how in the hect is this going to help, but it is. And, I feel like I'm accomplishing so much more than my weight loss. Lost 17.4 lbs in less than 5 weeks!! Try it! You won't regret it.

Great app... I am just starting to work out again after having 2 children over the past 5 years, and don't have the time or money to go to the gym or hire a trainer... And this is so perfect. Gives you short, but effective, workouts taylored to you and your individualized needs. I can't wait to c what changes it made for me at the end of my 1st 28 days!!!

Ok in my 1st review I failed to mention: Each day is a different set of exercises- so it won't get mundane. And you can set the difficulty higher or lower. The "water" reminder is great but it seems like its reminding me ALLOT. Yes, water intake is hard for me. Lol. Its quick & easy exercises (as in no equipment). All exercises can be done in a small space. No excuses. ‚ò∫

I've only been using this app for a few days, but so far I'm really enjoying it. There's ads I have to watch because I don't pay for the premium version, but they aren't invasive and it's worth it to be able to do the workouts they offer. Usually workout apps only give you 1 or 2 workouts and then you have to upgrade to keep using but this one does not do that. It walks you through the workout and is just generally a nice and encouraging app.

I am not at all motivated to work out, but I LOVE this app - so simple, great training tips, nothing complicated. Easy for beginners, and has intermediate/accelerated tips as well to make it harder if you want! Definitely feel the workout, done with day 1 in 11.5 mins! Easy to add to my morning routine, optional workout reminder (it politely asks if you'd like it set, without setting it for you). Total no nonsense app - highly recommend.

This app is freaking awesome. I'm lazy as hell and I haven't worked out in YEARS. This app lets me burn a few calories and make slow progress without feeling overwhelmed or like I'm failing at something. The descriptions of each workout move are great, you rate your exhaustion level afterwards, it gives you a decent estimate of calorie burn, and its aesthetic is adorable. Highly recommend.

Fantastic! The Best! This app has been foundational in finally changing my shape and getting fit after a lifetime of being overweight. Of course, there's been a lot of healthy changes in my diet and I do other kinds of exercises, this app really has changed my torso completely and gives me a lot of motivation but still on track! It's a dream -- perfect!

This is a great app I've only had it for about 3 days and so far it works very well downloaded and installed quick and easy. The controls in the app are easy to use and understand, it can remind me to workout at whatever time I set it to. It has breaks in between the exercises and I can skip straight to the next exercise if I want. It allows me to set a weight goal and it has different realistic exercises to do everyday so it's not boring. I'm sure I can reach my goals with the help of this app.

Easy to use, motivating, the exercises are short, enjoyable & not difficult. You can chose to work up a sweat or just do a routine for a warm up. I have accidentally skipped over an exercise a couple times but it's easy to either pause the next or just tap it for the explanation, which automatically pauses it, do the previous exercise then continue with the current one on screen. I like the motivational cheer after, too. My only con is that I wish it could sync with my Fitbit. Happy to have it

I like the app, they have a nice selection of workouts and different difficulty levels. It is good for someone who wants to get in shape and loss weight but that has limited time and prefers to do it at home. My only complaint is that while choosing out a workout initially I could see a few exercise options but once I started one of them, I couldn't access the rest of them anymore and got stock on one repetitive routine without the option to have any variation.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks so much for your support. You can choose different free workout plans by the button at the upper left corner of plan card of homepage. Hope you can achieve your goal and have a nice day!

scraped_reviews.content: So far so good. Very smooth transition. It also doesn't keep just on exercise routine. It does different ones to make sure to get results. It tricks the muscles to keep them from getting content and be immune to your goals. I like that it talks to make it feel more personal. I recommend especially for those that think they don't have time or energy. This makes it too easy not do something for yourself.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi friend, thanks so much for your support. We will keep working hard to bring you a better experience. Have a nice day!

scraped_reviews.content: There are in app purchase options but I only use the free workout plans. 2 months in, I am down 35 pounds. I didn't remove any foods I don't like. I portion control. Walk daily for minimum of 30 minutes (for me about a mile and a half in that time) and do this app everyday before bed. Works for me and have a few friends and strangers now using it. I personally recommend this as I have seen great results by what I listed here üòä good luck ladies! ‚ù§Ô∏èüí™üèª

So far so good. The exercises are things I can actually do, whereas other apps started out with more advanced training even though I was new. I appreciate that I don't need weights to do these workouts. I felt the workout in my core for 2 days, so this app's routine definitely has an affect! Looking forward to finally shedding a few pounds.

I love this app so far. I was hesitant at first cause I have a hard time remembering to work out and staying motivated or feeling like I have time. But this app will send you a reminder whenever you set it to and the workouts are not too difficult or time consuming at all and I can still tell it's definitely making a difference. The ads are more than tolerable compared to other apps, you rarely see them but I'm still considering going premium because the price honestly isn't bad at all.

I've only completed day 1 so far, but I like that the app walks you through each exercise with countdowns, a replaying GIF of someone showing the motions, and gives you the chance to skip the rest period of you wish. It's also great to see how long it took. I skipped most of the breaks for more of a high intensity workout, and it only took about 9 minutes.

Omg okay so the Lose Weight App for Women is like a total game-changer! üí™üíñ It gives you super easy, no-equipment workouts you can do anywhere, plus cute meal plans and daily goals that actually motivate you üò≠‚ú®. It tracks progress, reminds you to move, and literally keeps you on your glow-up grind. üå∏üî• Perfect for busy girls who want to stay fit, confident, and consistent! üíÉüí´

Today is my day 1, I am using the free version write now. It is just like when I used to go for exercise a place close to my house, and lost approx 5 kgs in 4-5 months without changing anything else like my diet and exercise. I would love to stick to this app as long as I can. Felt amazing doing exercise with it. Just hope it would help me reduce weight faster as i want to reduce it now and am working on my diet too.

I really love this workout app! The exercises are clear, effective, and easy to follow. It‚Äôs helped me stay consistent and reach my fitness goals. Everything works smoothly and the design is great. The only downside is that it has a few ads, but they‚Äôre not too bad. Overall, totally worth five stars!
