summary: ClassDojo connects teachers, kids, and families

scraped_reviews.content: persistent advertisements to upgrade are annoying. first and foremost the app is supposed to be free. you only pay to add additional features. but the advertisement is made to appear like you have 7 days free and then you have to pay $69.99 for the year. if you find the x and close you get pestered for $34.99 last chance deal. well now that advertisement comes up Everytime I open the app. ridiculous. don't get me started on app security... it's flawed too.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi from Dojo Support! üíö Thanks for this feedback.ClassDojo is free to use with your child‚Äôs school, and Plus is an optional subscription. We also take the privacy and security of your data and your child's data very seriously. Can you please email us at hello@classdojo.com so we can learn more?

scraped_reviews.content: For the most part, it's fine. What irritates me the most is that every time I get a code sent to me, it creates a "new child" instead of just adding the class to an existing child profile. I currently have 4 active profiles for my son and 3 for my daughter. I have to go through and delete multiple old profiles every new school year. You want us to pay for the app to keep memories from years past, but I would have no less than 30 profiles between 2 kids if I saved them all! Just ridiculous!!!!

Public schools shouldn't use an app that promotes its pay features so aggressively. Today I got a "message" in the chat that was just a pitch to sign up for the paid tutoring. Overall, the app is fine, stable, easy to navigate. But if we're required to use the app by our public schools, there should be a harder line between free and premium features.

In general, it is easy to navigate the app, although the notifications keep repeating itself, even after checking the messages. It can come as late as 2 days after. And as of late, after opening the app, there is a notification for an update. But I am unable to click on the "install" button when prompted. the notification simply vanished. Looking in the Google app store, apparently there isn't any update. So is there even an update?

I hate this app with a fiery passion. It's very likely that this could be used very effectively by teachers, but with at least a dozen notifications a day I'm forced to silence it while I'm at work. If there were options to silence specific types of notifications and highlight others, it might be useful. Do I care that my child got +1 point for lunch? No, not in the least. Do I care that there's a new assignment that's due on [date]? Yes.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi from Dojo Support! üíö Thanks for your honest feedback. We understand how overwhelming all the notifications can feel. We‚Äôll share your suggestion about choosing which alerts to receive with our team as we look for ways to improve.

scraped_reviews.content: I absolutely love this app and have used it for years. Some of the more recent updates have made it harder to use in class. Most notably, when using the random tool, the students' last initial and monster no longer pop up making it impossible to tell students apart if I have more than one with the same first name. I hope some of these features will be revised soon.

PLEASE stop asking me if I want to upgrade to a paid account every time I open your app - I don't. Our daycare already pays you for your service and your popup messages are intrusive enough to make initial navigation in the app difficult and so frequent I don't even want to open it to see what my little ones are up to at school. None of the other apps our daycare has used in the (remind me, lilo, seesaw, etc.) were like this. To daycares/schools: Avoid this app, there are better options...

I wish all teachers used this app. its fun, interactive, and easy to communicate with teachers. lots of feedback on schoolwork. point systems and rewards for kids, and online games with other students in her class. the app is free but you have to pay for a premium subscription if you want to do more things like give more points or get into the games for $10 a month. I refuse to pay for an app that should all be free.

I think Class Dojo makes it easy to keep in touch with your child's teacher. I have 4 stars due to the fact that in order to use the app completely (all it has to offer, but it is NOT necessary, either) you hv to upgrade. I understand that but a school app, not by the school, but one they use, should be. but it's a business I understand. I love the fact that u can email the teacher and tap "urgent" and they get the email immediately. I hv had a reply back instantly. it's great.

I Can't Believe Schools Use This.... it's adware promising academic success by paying for a subscription. Shameful. 'You Child's BEST Year' all for only $70 per year... They can say it's free, but the reality is that they are paywalling content that would help you as a parent, and then offering it to you, if you pay a subscription. They promise your child's best year - if you pay. They collect data from the teacher, in the form of 'points' and then sell you the feature of basic aggregation.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi from Dojo Support! üíö To clarify, ClassDojo is always free for teachers, schools, and parents to use. The optional Plus subscription is never required for messaging teachers or staying connected. If you‚Äôd like, you can reach us at hello@classdojo.com to share more feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: Slow, buggy, expensive, does some things well. The app takes an age to load, over a minute sometimes, it's buggy I've just loaded the app, waited to start and the logo was the stuck over the app after loading. I get a notification, which keeps repeating every time I start the app for a post by a teacher 8 days ago which I've opened. You want people to buy the app, make it more affordable AND make it actually work.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi from Dojo Support! üíö Really sorry about the loading delays and repeated notifications. That‚Äôs not the experience we want for you. Can you please email us at hello@classdojo.com with your device info? We‚Äôd love to dig in and help.

scraped_reviews.content: I've had this app for many years for both of my kids. it has always worked great....until a few minutes ago. I go to read a message from one of my kids teachers and the app FORCES me to crack an egg for a new teacher. I do that and go thru all the steps just to get met with a screen that refuses to change. I've pressed the button to change screens so many times and even hit the back button. nothing works. something needs to be done.

I use a Samsung Galaxy to access this app. The app is convenient for schools to send out mass notifications to all family's, and has the ability to message school staff. However the app is inconsistent in pushing through notifications when they appear, so I have to go into the app frequently to verify I haven't missed anything. It also doesn't give the ability to search for a staff member to message them, they have to initiate the message.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi from Dojo Support! üíö Thanks so much for your thoughtful feedback. We‚Äôre glad ClassDojo helps you stay connected, and we‚Äôre sorry for the trouble with notifications and messaging. We‚Äôd love to look into this further‚Äîplease reach out to us at hello@classdojo.com so we can help!

scraped_reviews.content: Constant ads to pay and 'upgrade'. The website is no better, and tries to force you to download the app. Only way around it is to manually 'view as desktop' when using a mobile browser. I've never gotten an email notification from them, as it says you should if you don't have the app. I dont understand why schools are forcing this on parents, it was so much easier when we just got emails about everything. If it wasn't the only way to see updates, I wouldn't use any of their services. FCPS in VA
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi from Dojo Support! üíö Thanks for the detailed feedback. We‚Äôre sorry the upgrade prompts and web access have been frustrating. ClassDojo is always free to use for school updates, and your notes about notifications and usability are very helpful for our team.

scraped_reviews.content: Notifications are a nightmare! Why can't there be a centralized place to see all notifications? You're notified 100x for the same thing, even after repeatedly viewing it! But I still feel I need to check, just in case. Need to go back to a specific post? Can't find it! Our teacher shares info as a comment to her original post made at the beginning of the school year! A notifications tab, would make it so much easier! I screenshot now and avoid digging through the app altogether!

I really don't like the fact that I have to download yet another app just to talk to my son's teacher, and then to have to pay for it too, minus the limited user access you allow if you don't pay. I think that by teachers using this as a point system for children isn't the greatest idea. Although a point system can be handy and beneficial for the kids to work towards something; I just think it's one more thing the teacher has to do on a screen instead of actually paying attention to the kids.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi from Dojo Support! üíö Thanks for sharing your thoughts. The app is always free for teachers, schools, and parents. Plus is optional! We‚Äôll pass along your feedback about points and teacher workload to our team, as well.

scraped_reviews.content: Great for teachers, not so much for parents. I'm glad my kids can interact with their teachers, and I'm glad we can, too... But the app definitely has its limitations. It doesn't clear notifications (even when they've been checked). It's constantly trying to get me to purchase features (like nonstop) even though we only use it for their teachers' sakes. It's constantly sending random notifications and there's no way to turn them off (things that have nothing to do with our classrooms).

I really enjoy using this app to communicate with my child's teacher and school. Two things I'd like to suggest: 1, adding a search bar. My child's school/teachers send several messages a week, it's so time consuming to try to find an older message without flipping through 30 first. If it's from more than a week ago, forget about it lol. 2, having a way to sync events and dates straight into your calendar. Overall, I enjoy it though.

Overall I love it, I've had it for multiple years at this point. The only downside is that so many more features USED to be available for FREE! Now the plus version is being pushed very hard, too much in my opinion. For ex.. I used to be able to give at home points almost everyday, even if it was a cap of 2 or 3, now you can't at all. You could see as far back in activity now you can't. I just can't believe so many awesome features were taken away!

Overall, I like this app. The main problem I have is the inability to zoom in on posts. My child's teacher posts a picture of the agenda for the week to save on her alloted clicks for the year. Every week, I have to screen shot it so that I can zoom in to read it. The same goes with pictures. It's annoying to screen shot a picture to just to see IF my son is in a picture. I spend alot of time going through my gallery to see which dojo pics are current/relevant. Let me zoom in for 5 stars!!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Valarie! Could you send this feedback to us at hello@classdojo.com? Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I am having issues this new school year as well with messages/notifications not coming up. Yes, 'push notifications' and 'allow notifications' are all turned on. There wasn't any issues last year. Is it because there is a past year in there now? It's frustrating. I know others that are having this issue too. Can you help? Other that that, I love the app!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there, can you please send us an email at hello@classdojo.com so we can look into this for you? Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I love e idea of this app, however I just feel there is a slew of additional information, editing tools, etc. that could be incorporated. For instance, when delving out a child's 'reward' w/pic, one should be able to add caption. (similar to a social media post) Certainly a lot more things that could be helpful for communicating a "story" of sorts between teacher's, and the parents community as a whole entity.

UPDATE: as of today 3/16/22 I finally rec'd a confirmation of my subscription. I do like this app. The Subscription is nice because I can see when someone has read my message, and I can give "points" to my kids, and if they reach enough points, they get an ice-cream over the weekend (or fun at the park, or the arcade...whatever). It's mainly so I can add more incentive for good behavior 3/12/2022 Just signed up "to unlock ClassDojo Plus" and nothing happens...tried subscribing with the annual purchase, and was supposedly going to get a 7 day free trial...and nothing happens (no email confirmation, no app notification...nada!)...may as well NOT subscribe folks ... if the issue is resolved, I'll update my review.

I really really really need there to be notifications for when the teacher assigns things, because our class discussions sometimes correspond with Dojo prompts, but sometimes they don't, and because of this, I am always accidentally missing assignments! This is especially bad because the app doesn't always load or turn on, (though part of that might be because of the sketchy WiFi at school) and because of this, I often don't check for assignments by spending five minutes loading the app.

Like others have mentioned, this app has stopped sending push notifications (e.g., when my child's teacher sends a private message or posts to the class). I've missed important health related announcements due to this. Don't know if this is just an issue with the Android app. Parents with iPhones don't seem to be experiencing the same problem. ETA: And yes, I have the notification settings for the app turned on.

Definitely seems helpful and hopefully will be an effective, efficient, and just overall great way to communicate with my child's Teacher! However, it is a bit confusing, and could definitely do without the constant "Pay to Uograde" options which are seemingly around every corner. Or more accurately, every "Click," for lack of better words.

I absolutely love the app when it works, but even though I've been subscribed to Plus for several weeks, I almost am never able to use the plus features. I uninstalled and re-installed, but it still tells me to subscribe. I was even going to pay again just because it kept prompting me when I needed access, but then I get an error code that I'm already subscribed, and "we are unable to perform this action, please try again later." I even got a new phone, but it still did not make "later" come.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Shannon, can you drop us an email at plus@classdojo.com so we can look into this for you? We'd be happy to help!

scraped_reviews.content: Plus bugs I pay for plus and the recent update changed the goal feature. It no longer allows me to set a progressive goal. For instance, it used to allow me to set a goal for reading. 5 points was the total. Any time they would read, I could press it and it would give 1 point up to 5 times. It no longer does and just gives the whole point total of 5pts. Also, I never get push notifications to inform me about point given from the teachers and sometimes messages.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there, if you are still experiencing this issue please drop us an email at plus@classdojo.com. We'd be happy to look into this for you!

scraped_reviews.content: The longer I am forced the use this app for my kid's school, the more I really really (really) dislike it. The overkill on the "Try ClassDojo Plus" ads and banners. It's extremely confusing and hard to navigate what the teacher actually sends vs upsells. I can't see the "points" without upgrading. If it wasn't required for school communication I'd delete in a heartbeat, which is a shame since it COULD be good.

I shouldn't have to pay "unlock the full experience" to use an app to view my child's class when I pay taxes. Also, I'm tired of the constant having to download an app to my phone, when the web browser is just as good, but this ClassDojo forces you to do this. Remove this feature, make it free (not free since we pay taxes), and the constant pop-ups, and it's probably a better experience.

I think this is a great app and I've never had a problem receiving msgs, pictures and videos from the teachers! I've used this app for several years to keep up with my grandkids schoolwork and communication from their teachers. The only thing I haven't enjoyed is the weekly msg I've gotten from the app telling me to look at my childs activity. When you click on it, it's just a gimmick to get you to signup for the premium service which I didn't want or need! Annoying... The app is great without.

It's an okay app. It's actually easier to just email or text the teacher. At first you could use the site just online, but now it forces you to download the app, or it won't work, which is ridiculous. I'm not sure why most of the features are blocked unless you have a premium plan that is overpriced, I guess it's their way of making more money for something basic. Our school switched to another site that works better but teacher continues to use dojo for some assignments so we're stuck with it.

I'm a daycare teacher. For the 2nd time in 2 months, the app will no longer show me the reports when I put them in. The last time this happened, I went without seeing the reports for about 2 weeks then one day I could all of a sudden see them again. I can put awards in, but if I need to edit an award or remove an accidental award, then I cant. If this isn't resolved by end of day today, my school will no longer be using this app. Its a real headace and an unnecessary inconvenience.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Oh no! We sincerely apologize for the troubles you've had with the app. We'd be happy to take a look into this for you, please contact us at hello@classdojo.com. Thank you.

scraped_reviews.content: This app was awesome last year. A great way to connect with my daughters teacher. This year, trying to add her new teacher was exactly as everyone that gave a poor rating stated. Literally went in circles, it was so frustrating. So I logged in from my laptop and was able to add the new information for this school year easily. It automatically updated the info to the app on my android device. Glad I was able to figure something out. Looking forward to the new school year.

The application offers little in terms of accessibility to students class work and lesson plans. The program will also automatically subscribe you, with no way of cancellation. We bought one month's worth of subscription, simply so we can track our own son's progress. And then, they have the galls to charge us for the following months.Teachers: really, look elsewhere for class tracking application. Parents: urge your child's teacher to choose a different app. Edit: We didn't subscribe from google play store. We still can't cancel.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello there, you can cancel your subscription at any time through the Google Play Store. If you need any help with this please email us at hello@classdojo.com!

scraped_reviews.content: Overall, it is a great way to communicate with those who educate your child. I give the app 4 out 5 because if you want to do things like save pictures, you have to pay. Not just a flat rate but a subscription. I don't feel like this kind of tool should be allowed to charge for what would otherwise would be free. Imagine if everyone used Facebook groups instead. All the features would be the same with no added fee's.

It was more usable before. Now, every feature that made it good requires a subscription, such as being able to see if a teacher has viewed your message. I'm not paying for an app that is essentially just used for messaging and putting out information. Having a way to separate the announcements from multiple schools would make it much better. Information easily got buried with 2 schools posting 3-10 times a week each.

This does not appear to be "100% free" as advertised. It's required for my kid's kindergarten class, but without purchasing the 'plus' version, that is annoyingly advertised every other click, I can't really do anything with it. I can't even customize my kid's monster avatar or assign more than three points. From my experience so far, I'd say it is more accurate to say it's free to view a limited amount of things but you have to pay for it to really function as intended.

The app itself is good. The only thing I'd add is a translation part. As not everyone is bilingual, not in a bad way. With the program you can't copy the text written. So it makes it hard to use a translation app to figure out what's being said. With an internal translator it would make it easier for those who don't speak a second language to be able to still communicate w/the other parents. It would help all involved as this app is used in schools where communication is key w/staff and parents.

I understand needing money to support the program in the app store but... I also feel it's a little unfair when it comes to any kind of educational app where less privileged people might not be able to participate. To base an entire school program and notification system on an that some things need to be purchased... is very unfair for the kids. Other than that, it's great!

First off it has been wonderful to communicate with teacher and uploaded the kids work directly from our phones. The one problem we have is the app uses lots of internal storage on the phone. 12G of storage so far that cannot be saved on the SD card. If they could make it where the data is stored on your SD card like other apps do then I would give it 5 stars in a heartbeat.

I'm kinda uncertain. I like how I can see daily what things my child is good at, or needs work on. However, we all know there is a premium version. Right from the moment you sign up. I can't even count to 5 before I'm being prompted to buy. For something the school participates in, I feel it's a bit predatory. Honestly, my 9k a year taxes should cover it. I just don't care for the constant purchase harassment.

Good for receiving content from the teacher, but the messaging -- a key feature, one would think -- are inconsistent at best. Typically, we'll get pop-up notifications that the teacher is sending us a message, but the new messages won't load in the app. It's just a constant loading circle... The website works as expected, at least.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there, can you please delete the app, reinstall the app, and then log back in? If this does not work please drop us an email at hello@classdojo.com so we can look into this for you!

scraped_reviews.content: It's a good app in theory, but it's very buggy. As others have stated, doesn't send notifications. You have to manually log in to check. When you do that, you're prompted three different times. You click "I have an account", "I'm a parent", and then the profile name. I also have the same issue that others do where read messages aren't marked as such. If I'm going to be forced to use this crappy app, you all need to ensure that it works correctly across all platforms.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Lisa, please drop us an email at hello@classdojo.com so we can help with this!

scraped_reviews.content: Experienced glitches with chats. Paid for the annual subscription at the start of last school year. Realized it wasn't needed for the new year, and uninstalled it. Got a notice that subscription was going to renew in 3 days, but I had to reinstall the app to cancel. And the cancelation button doesn't work. I missed the cancelation deadline and now paid for another year I don't need. Who gives 3 days notice instead of 30 for a subscription renewal? Leaving this review purely to call that out.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Rebecca, I'm so sorry to hear about your experience. We are always happy to assist with refund requests, and I see that our team was able to assist you with canceling and refunding your subscription on September 8th. We've also made improvements to our app since then, and we hope the latest update is providing a better experience for you.

scraped_reviews.content: I like using this app, it's a good way to stay in touch with teachers. However, lately the app keeps crashing on me ever since my child switched teachers a few weeks ago. I continue receiving the introduction pop-up to meet the new teacher BUT I've gone through that step, having a couple messages back and forth with said teacher. Yet I keep receiving the pop-up every time I open the app, getting stuck with a frozen screen if I do click on the pop-up. Can't ignore it, otherwise app closes.

We're forced to use this because our kids' school communicates through it. Most of the useful features are behind a paywall. You can't search for individual posts, so if you're looking for something you have to scroll back through everything that's been posted by every teacher until you find it. The "messaging" feature is essentially texting, so it's hard to send detailed notes to a teacher. It's constantly asking me to rate the app with no option to say I never want to, so here you go Dojo! üëé

UPDATE: 9/15/23. I emailed class dojo, and they were able to resolve the issue. Changing my rating to 5 stars. Thank you ! /////This is a great to communicate with teachers. The issue is lately its been adding different teachers other than the one that my child has. Making it seem as if he has 2 teachers instead of 1 .There's no way to open the app or check messages without selecting the "new teacher" as an option.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there, if you are still experiencing this issue please drop us an email at hello@classdojo.com. We'd be happy to look into this for you!

scraped_reviews.content: Finicky app, expensive for what it is! First, navigation is finicky. It's difficult to get into the teacher pages from the parent portal on my Android phone. Sometimes the classes want to open, sometimes not. Secondly, for a connection to others app, it's cost prohibitive. I may pay 2-3$ a month for an app like this, but $8?!? That's the price of Netflix and they pay royalties for all the content they stream. Way more parents would use this if there was an annual rate of around $24-$36!!

I'm giving two stars because while it was great the first day or two after I downloaded the app. I can no longer see messages the teachers send. I cannot comment or heart react their stories. (glad I can see those, and how many points my kids are getting) I really wish this app would work the way it should. I've used data- switched on wifi- checked permissions. It keeps telling me "cannot load list of children. Try again later" days it's been doing this.

title: Microsoft Excel: Spreadsheets
description:
Budgeting, chart creation, data analytics and more ‚Äì all at your fingertips. The Excel spreadsheet and budgeting app lets you create, view, edit and share files, charts and data. Excel‚Äôs built-in file editor lets you manage your finances with on-the-go budget and expense tracking integration. We make it easy to review and analyze data, edit templates, and more.

With Excel you can confidently edit documents, track expenses, and compile charts and data . Create charts directly from your phone for convenient data analysis, accounting, and financial management. Access to spreadsheets, pivot tables and chart makers make budgeting in Excel easy.

Make spreadsheets and data files with robust formatting tools and features that boost your productivity. Build charts and sheets that meet specific needs with Excel‚Äôs wide array of worksheet resources.

Spreadsheets, business collaboration, charts and data analysis tools all on your phone with Microsoft Excel.

Microsoft Excel Features:

Spreadsheets & Calculations
‚Ä¢ Create charts, budgets, task lists, accounting & financial analysis with Excel's modern templates.
‚Ä¢ Use an accounting calculator, data analysis tools & familiar formulas to run calculations on spreadsheets.
‚Ä¢ Workbook sheets and charts are easier to read and use with rich features & formatting options.
‚Ä¢ Spreadsheet & chart features, formats & formulas operate the same way on any device.

Accounting, Budget & Expense Tracking
‚Ä¢ Budget Template: Spreadsheets & charts help calculate budget needs.
‚Ä¢ Budget Planner: Budget templates & tools to help you drill down to your finance needs.
‚Ä¢ Budget Tracker: Track expenses & save money.
‚Ä¢ Accounting app: Use as a tax calculator for estimates, personal finances & more.

Data Analysis
‚Ä¢ Chart maker: Annotate, edit & insert charts that bring data to life.
‚Ä¢ Data analysis: Add & edit chart labels to highlight key insights.
‚Ä¢ Budget tracker: Track expenses with a personal budget template.
‚Ä¢ Pivot Charts and spreadsheet visualization tools offer easily digestible formats.

Review and Edit
‚Ä¢ File editor: Edit documents, charts and data from anywhere.
‚Ä¢ Data analysis features like sort & filter columns.
‚Ä¢ Annotate charts, highlight parts of worksheets, create shapes & write equations with the draw tab on devices with touch capabilities.

Collaborate and Work Anywhere
‚Ä¢ Share files & Excel sheets in a few taps to invite others to edit, view or leave comments.
‚Ä¢ Edit & copy your worksheet in the body of an email or attach a link to your workbook.

Microsoft Excel is your all-in-one expense manager, chart maker, budget planner, and more. Get more done today with extensive spreadsheet tools to enhance your productivity.

REQUIREMENTS:
1 GB RAM or above

To create or edit documents, sign in with a free Microsoft account on devices with a screen size smaller than 10.1 inches.

Unlock the full Microsoft 365 experience with a qualifying Microsoft 365 subscription for your phone, tablet, PC and Mac.

Microsoft 365 subscriptions purchased from the app will be charged to your Play Store account and will automatically renew within 24 hours prior to the end of the current subscription period, unless auto-renewal is disabled beforehand. You can manage your subscriptions in your Play Store account settings. A subscription cannot be cancelled during the active subscription period.

This app is provided by either Microsoft or a third-party app publisher and is subject to a separate privacy statement and terms and conditions. Data provided through the use of this store and this app may be accessible to Microsoft or the third-party app publisher, as applicable, and transferred to, stored, and processed in the United States or any other country where Microsoft or the app publisher and their affiliates or service providers maintain facilities.

Please refer to Microsoft's EULA for Terms of Service for Microsoft 365 on Android. By installing the app, you agree to these terms and conditions: http://aka.ms/eula

summary: Use powerful, industry-leading AI tools to generate visual charts from any data

scraped_reviews.content: App has lots of bugs. Data randomly disappears, & I cant find a reason behind it. at least once a month, the app says I don't have permission to make edits. The only fix is to uninstall & reinstall the app, which is not efficient. Every few days, all of my spreadsheets are locked out on my phone, & I have to log in again, although it shows I am logged in. Everything else Office365 and One drive still work, but excel locks up. This happens also happens when its in use. File just vanishes.

I switched from using Sheets to Excel because I like Excel's desktop functionality and I thought the app would be great for on the go use. However, I've had problem after problem. I get kicked out of my profile. I get told there's no account associated with my email. The desktop data doesn't always transfer to the app/web version. Whole spreadsheets will go missing from the app and are only available on desktop even though I used the app before. I may go back to using Sheets.

Has an Extremely serious bug that results in data loss! Excel fails to stage file saves, so when exiting and edited file, it tries to save .... but occasionally the app is prevented by the Android OS or other unknown reason. So BAMM!!! The entire file is corrupted and shows 0 bytes. All data lost. Full data loss occurred multiple times! HORRIBLE APP!!!

I was tracking all my expenses, it was great. Saved my file and that's done. Next day tried opening the file, it won't open. Oh well. Next day, all data lost ü§¶üèΩ. Searched all my documents and non existent. I started over. Next day it's gone again. The file I saved on android app won't load, says "the file isn't available in this location" smh is this official Microsoft? If so, fire all the devs. Worst Microsoft product I've ever used.

I have been using Microsoft Excel for several years now. Yesterday, when I opened my budgeting spread sheet for this month, it would not open. I lost ALL of my budgeting information, right at the exact time when ALL of my bills are due. Microsoft also has removed the ability to "save as", which I NEED, so that I can save previous versions of my monthly budgets. Now, there is only a save icon, with no "save as". THIS SUCKS, 100%

i have been using MS for a long time and paid for premium, and one day suddenly they cancelled my premium because of some payment problem, i tried making payments for many times and for some reason the payment cannot go through, funny thing is i could make payment for other apps. So now all most of my excel files are gone, and i have no idea how to retrieve them. it's so frustrating!

it's good but I am not able to do conditional formatting for my school work. I I have no laptop at the moment. I don't know any other way to do the last part. also, the inserting pics from clip art is not there. I found pics online but when I put it in, it just doesn't look how it's supposed to. it's either in front of the cells or in the cell but can't make it larger. everything else is really good though!

I use Excel every day for multiple files. Recently opened files used to show up at the top when I open Excel. Now some files show up, other times the files that were listed last time are missing but there are files I have not opened for months showing. It's just random. I keep having to go deep into my folder structure each time to find files I just opened earlier today. I don't know what you did but roll it back! This sucks! It's extremely inconvenient and time consuming

This app always logs me out, even while I'm still logged into other MS apps, and I can't edit anything. The error says "There's a problem with your account or device. Let's fix it." The continue button does not work for me. I am logged into three accounts; they all do this. I have to clear app data to fix. When everything works, it will only show me one sheet, even if I opened in on my PC minutes before. The app works great other than this, when I can actually open and edit my spreadsheets.

I have used Excel since it's very first version. This is the first time an app has told me that the program is "no longer compatible with your device" as a way of disallowing me use, so obviously I'm not a happy camper. How can a company reach back into your computer to effectively delete a program from your hand drive? Sounds like the tactics of the data pirates holding your data hostage until payment.

PROS: There are NO ADS! It does everything a spreadsheet is supposed to do. There is a little learning curve, but it is easy to learn. The spreadsheet that I work on often can be pinned, added to the home screen, and it will automatically open and then just exit, and it will save automatically. CON: Poor color selection for fonts/highlights. They are different from the standard like blue looks like sky blue. I have to copy and paste the right color from another app to get it right. RECOMMENDED

It does a good job as a mini excel, but somehow the developers decided to make it incredibly difficult to access files on an external sd card. You can't edit any file on an sd card. Internal storage is limited so external should be accessible. To make matters worse, now I'm constantly being signed out and I have to sign in every couple of days. To the developers: your logic is backward. Cell phones are personal, quit signing users out.

I enjoyed using Excel on my PC and Laptop for many years. So why not continue to use Excel to manage spreadsheets on my Android devices! It works very well and I'm familiar with many of the application features. Excel is the 'Gold Standard' when it comes to spreadsheet applications. Rich with so many features and very powerful for organizing, sorting, retrieving, charting, and presenting both numeric as well as alphabetic data.

I've liked Excel pretty much back to its inception. Right now I'm having an issue trying to allow access to my SD card. When I try and load an Excel sheet from the SD card, the software has a problem. It doesn't take me back to the SD card it takes me to the download folder, with no other options. This particular file is constantly updated by myself and saved with a new name each time. This is the most important Excel document I have, and I have constant issues with it. I wish you would fix it.

Crashes a lot. Before the crashes, it was a good app, integrating well with Dropbox, but then it started crashing for no reason. Another "great" app from microSOFT. And where did conditional formatting go? I tried to do a "smart lookup" on it to get some "help" but it does absolutely nothing and returns me to my sheet. I guess I found a hole... Overall, missing a few great features from the desktop app, slow, buggy, and not at all efficient. The only thing it does well is reminding me of the real deal on a computer, and then I shudder at that.

Excel for Android has come a long way since it's inception. I've always used it on Windows as Mac, but the app on my phone has always been missing something to make it a keeper for daily use. The current version of Excel is very easy to use and has several features that make the creation of spreadsheets on my Samsung S9+ easy. I believe a bit more thought should be given to formatting cells and so forth, since this is still a bit counterintuitive, but it is possible with a bit of practice.

I have had no issues with this app after many years of using it until the most recent update. My files keep going into a state that they cannot be opened and I have to open it on my computer and restore it(which does not remove my last changes), save it, and then I can open them. Once I reopen them and change anything, it will do the same exact thing. So frustrating. Please fix it!

I can work around the limited app functions. I can work around the incredibly small screen. What I can't work with is the inability to use the app across all devices. The app will only open old spreadsheets. So if Im on the go I can't just open my work since I made adjustments/corrections using a computer yesterday. My solution was to resave the computer spreadsheet with a different name, each time, and use the app to open that new spreadsheet. Defeats the purpose of the app.

"This version of Excel doesn't support running or interacting with form controls.". I was excited. My work requires me to fill out pre-made excel templates, and I finally didn't have to lug my laptop around with me. But they use a bubble checkmark system which appearantly the mobile version doesnt support for some reason. Works fine on desktop. 1 star. Fix it.

Terrible loading times. It tries to re-download the workbook every time, which takes minutes even for the smallest files. I don't know why they don't let you immediately work from cache and sync in the background. This is a consumer product, not some Enterprise 360 business project. Google docs and OneNote are more seemless. I enable airplane mode to speed up loading. Sometimes it doesn't sync if you switch tasks. This app is also very lot lite on Excel features.

I love this app. It has been great to be able to work on a file and then if I'm or I can quickly access it on my phone and update it BUT as of the last couple of weeks when I open any files on my phone or said "read only"and won't allow me to access it except for when I'm at home on my laptop. It's very inconvenient. If there is a fix up change my rating back to a 5.

It's awesome that we can edit excel sheets on our phones, but the mobile app is not very intuitive. Some things are a pain to figure out how to do, for example simply inserting cells, and some thing are clunky, like selecting a cell to edit. It makes sense that the mobile app wouldn't be microsoft's focus, but I think the idea to try and get the ability to do everything on mobile, instead of doing a few things well, was misguided.

It took some time to figure how to do certain things ( bring up keyboard, alphabetize, format, etc) and the help button wasn't very helpful. After several days and pushing every button I was able to do everything except cut and paste. I never did find that action. This was my first time using excel on a tablet...it was a little easier on a computer. It does take practice.

Finally! Excel on my phone I have been using a different note app for my grocery list. Unfortunately, it won't total and I can't fill in quantities I need vs. what I have in my cart. I have worked with Excel heavily at my job, so this works really well for me!! The only issue I have is that some times too many popup menus get in the way of progress. I'm catching on to that, too.

This app is very helpful for a person who does not have a laptop, and is working while also in school. Being able to creat a spreadsheet without having to carry extra luggage is great. The only problem I have from time to time is the loading of my files. When using a cloud storage some of the files will not show up sometimes. Not a big problem when around a computer, but definitely a nuisance, whether around a computer or not.

Microsoft has no idea how terrible their Chromebook products are. If you're used to using Microsoft office products on Windows, you will pull your hair out using them on Chromebook. Simple functions are impossible. For example trying to insert a column or row in Excel requires you to right-click multiple times just to get the option to appear. In Word, you can't even use the tab button to indent. It's laughable that Microsoft actually wants us to pay for this pathetic product

Overall it's ok. The PC version is much easier to use. The one thing I don't like is that it doesn't automatically go into landscape mode when I rotate my phone like almost every other app. Many updates ago it used to but not anymore. Now you have to tap the little icon in the corner and instruct it to go into landscape mode. The problem is if you don't undo it before you close the app, your phone's home screen remains in landscape mode. You have to go back into the excel app and change it.

Lowering my rating after using this for a while.. It has a lot of useful features similar to the desktop app. However it just doesn't play well with files stored on Dropbox. Whether I open a spreadsheet from Dropbox app or the shortcut to it in Excel, this MS app doesn't have the recent changes from the cloud even though it says it is "downloading" the file. But if I delete the file on Excel, it actually deletes the file in Dropbox. Thankfully Dropbox has a restore feature.

Why is it so bugy..? I opted to pay for this so I can use it on my 12" tablet instead of just using it for free on my phone...yet the paid version freezes, crashes and closes randomly. If I want to jump between this app and another, it closes every time. On my phone....not a single issue. You would think that the paid version would work better.

After updating this app, now doesn't work as displays a message "we are working on signing you in from another app. Please try again in a few minutes" when trying to open a spreadsheet. Trying again in hours does not change the outcome. Frustrating as app rendered useless. Update. After 2 weeks and no fix decided to uninstall and reinstall. That fixed it.

Horrible experience. Used to be able to edit with this app, now I need another one? But the 365 app (now changed to copilot because of course?). But that app just opens spreadsheets in this app, which doesn't let me edit despite subscription... Just unnecessarily confusing. Tired of not being able to use what I'm paying for.

Two persistent problems are:- 1. Matters not what you do, the error "One or more accounts require you to sign back in" always persists. Not a problem on iOS, only on Android. Never fixed! 2. Unable to zoom-out more than 50% on my Galaxy Fold 6 when in the larger 'tablet' display mode. Unfortunately this is quite debilitating; yet on the S24 Ultra phone, one can zoom-out to 25%, despite the S24 Ultra display being much smaller than the Galaxy Fold 6 in 'tablet' mode. This needs fixing asap.

It is incredibly convenient to have this app on my phone. I can access and work on my files wherever I am. From my limited exploration of the app, many of the features available on the desktop version are available here. The ONLY reason for not giving 4 stars is because it is difficult to use the app and all of it's features, on a phone.

Recurring issue where it says "one or more accounts require you to sign back in" and it forgets all your recent docs. It's lying, the account is fine and if you manually open books thru OneDrive it works every time... Then forgets it and gives you the error next time the app closes. Every other O365 app works fine. Signing out doesn't fix it. Reinstalling app doesn't fix it. Microsoft support useless and doesn't know how to fix it. Reddit posts haven't found any solutions. Fix your app.

It's free, it's very easy to use from your phone. I am giving it 4 stars for the simple reason I can't add my logo to any document there is not a option to add it. Other than that it's really worth the download and use and easy to send it to a printer or directly to clients or to a printing company. Also easy to save as PDF if and when needed. Keep up the good work creator of this app just please add the logo add option for business owners working from their phones.

On galaxy fold 7 homepage within Excel app (the one where you can choose a templates or create a blank sheet) is broken when used on cover screen (when folded). half UI is missing and out of the screen. some text though fits the screen and autoscale. UPD.: also pinned excels and history of open files randomly disappears. shortcuts randomly becomes non functional, however files are not moving to any new location in cloud... strange behaviour.

Be careful when making spreadsheets while offline. When you reconnect to the a network, Excel will fail to log the workbook you had to Recent. It also doesn't have a properly functioning Recent tab, dropping well over 50% of your recent workbooks and sometimes getting worse every time you tap Recent.

If possible please add only view feature for the mobile app, and converting sheet into card is also very good feature, but in case of sharing a person has to select each card individually and all the card cannot be bundle into one, please review this and update it as soon as possible. Thank you excel for making our life easier.

my recent documents on the landing screen keeps disappearing no matter if I leave it on in background or not. I'm tired of looking for it everytime I want to use it. even tried to create a short cut on my home screen and it failed to be a short cut because it was grayed out and said my file could not be found.

I sign up for the free trial and use the mobile app. The next day, I am told via email that the trail will be canceled because I did not login. I reach out to customer service and after waiting for half an hour they tell me to contact a different customer service for the mobile app. I attempt to login to the app and it repeatedly asks for my phone number as backup, which I provide, and yet still does not let me login. I shouldn't need to waste hours of my day to keep a free trial.

Removed useful features. I used to be able to open multiple windows of excel and have them side by side. Working from my android tablet was a breeze. Now they removed that feature and I can no longer have multiple files open at the same time.

Very hard to use because the search bar disappears while you're going through search and trees, the tab bar at the bottom disappears when it wants to. the positive is that the online sync seems to work really well so far. overall - Google Sheets is way better... but that has problems with the online sync for me sometimes. The search function is so bad that I'm gonna have to switch back to Google Sheets.

It keeps blanking out the shortcut I have on my homescreen and then when I open the app, the latest version of my worksheet isn't in recent. I have to search thru documents to find it. Never had this problem until about a month ago and now it's a reoccurring thing.

this worked great for me since 2019... now it icons are disappearing from my phones and it's a constant fight to keep from losing all my spreadsheets! I have one with all my financial data from 2019 till present. I use it everyday but it looks like I will lose it all! I will find another app ........

Touchscreen version is horrible. 1) opening screen freezes 2) kept telling me Read-Only file 3) no font settings box on Home tab - no longer able to do multiple font, alignment, border, fill, etc settings in one go 4) unable to mix font styles in same cell (e.g. bold & regular text) 5) only one paste option (no value, formatting, etc) 6) what you copy isn't always what you paste - numbers in wrong columns/rows! Web version - could only create. This is it. Switching to another app to edit Excel!

I have signed in and out, cleared cache, updated the app, etc., and *still* I get signed out multiple times per week. Super frustrating, and I'm at wits end. It's been since earlier this year it's been happening, and it's unacceptable for something this essential for work and life.

I have been using the app for a very long time and it has been great. However, recently it won't open many of my excel sheets. As another reviewer mentioned, I also get a "gray ghosted excel sheet image on the screen with a white gradient that sweeps from left to right across the screen." The only way I have been able to fix this issue is to turn off "Remove permissions if app is unused" and "Pause app activity if unused" under Permissions in Excel in Apps in my phone's settings.

This APP is horrible. THE worst application of all my applications. Showed a duplicate file. When I deleted one file the other was deleted also. NOW I have lost the file. Very unreliable. CONSTANTLY having to figure out how to restore inadvertent changes made to cells. Wiping out vast amounts of data. So unreliable! Wish I could select negative stars for the review.

Microsoft are a disgrace. I have had trouble for months with my 365 subscription, having to log out of Onedrive, Excel and Word and sign in again on my tablet and phone. I got a demand that I renew my subscription when I hadn't cancelled it. Foolishly I fell for it and they billed me ¬£8.49 twice on top of my monthly subscription. I found I had opened three subscriptions with the same e-mail address: how is that even possible? I cancelled two only to find myself locked out completely. Scammers!

I like the program and I'm learning how to use it on my Android phone. I'd like to be able to save a link to the Excel sheet I'm working on on. I'm given the option to do so and accept it. It will work for a day or so, but then I receive a message that "I can't access it from this location". Sometimes it's displayed only vertically and other times I can access my pages horizontally, as if a different Excel program takes over. I use the program mostly for data, not accounting.
